perturbation.original_text: (i) Identification and Appointment of New Director B. No later than ninety (90) calendar days from the date of execution of this Agreement (the "New Director B Appointment Deadline"), the Company shall take the necessary steps to cause the Board to appoint one of the candidates set forth on Exhibit A (as the same may be supplemented or otherwise amended from time to time by the mutual constent of the Company and the Investor Group, the "Director Candidate Pool") as New Director B with a term on the Board expiring at the 2018 Annual Meeting and until his or her successor is duly elected and qualified.
perturbation.changed_text: (i) Identification and Appointment of New Director B. No later than one hundred and eighty (180) calendar days from the date of execution of this Agreement (the "New Director B Appointment Deadline"), the Company shall take the necessary steps to cause the Board to appoint one of the candidates set forth on Exhibit A (as the same may be supplemented or otherwise amended from time to time by the mutual constent of the Company and the Investor Group, the "Director Candidate Pool") as New Director B with a term on the Board expiring at the 2018 Annual Meeting and until his or her successor is duly elected and qualified.
perturbation.explanation: Delaying the deadline for appointing New Director B could be considered an unreasonable delay, particularly if the delay impedes the Investor Group's ability to influence board decisions. Some corporate governance standards suggest that board appointments should be handled expeditiously.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential breach of fiduciary duty or failure to act in good faith

perturbation.original_text: Each of the Investor Group and the Company shall determine, and inform the other party of its determination, whether any proposed replacement director candidate is acceptable and meets the foregoing criteria, within ten (10) business days after such party has conducted interview(s) of such proposed replacement director candidate. Each of the Company and the Investor Group shall use their respective reasonable best efforts to cause any interview(s) contemplated by this Section 1(f) to be conducted as promptly as practicable, but in any case, assuming reasonable availability of the proposed replacement director candidate, within ten (10) business days after the receipt of such director candidate's credentials, including, but not limited to, a completed copy of the Company's standard director and officer questionnaire. Upon acceptance of a replacement director candidate by both the Company and the Investor Group, the Board shall take such actions as to appoint such replacement director candidate to the Board no later than ten (10) business days after both parties have confirmed in writing that they have mutually agreed upon such candidate.
perturbation.changed_text: Each of the Investor Group and the Company shall determine, and inform the other party of its determination, whether any proposed replacement director candidate is acceptable and meets the foregoing criteria, within twenty-five (25) business days after such party has conducted interview(s) of such proposed replacement director candidate. Each of the Company and the Investor Group shall use their respective reasonable best efforts to cause any interview(s) contemplated by this Section 1(f) to be conducted as promptly as practicable, but in any case, assuming reasonable availability of the proposed replacement director candidate, within twenty-five (25) business days after the receipt of such director candidate's credentials, including, but not limited to, a completed copy of the Company's standard director and officer questionnaire. Upon acceptance of a replacement director candidate by both the Company and the Investor Group, the Board shall take such actions as to appoint such replacement director candidate to the Board no later than twenty-five (25) business days after both parties have confirmed in writing that they have mutually agreed upon such candidate.
perturbation.explanation: The extended timelines for candidate determination, interviews, and appointment provide opportunities for undue delays and interference in the board appointment process, undermining the intent of ensuring timely and effective board composition. Such delays can be viewed as breaches of fiduciary duty or attempts to frustrate the investor agreement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of fiduciary duty, violation of corporate governance standards.

perturbation.original_text: No later than five (5) business days prior to each annual or special meeting of stockholders held prior to the expiration of the Standstill Period, each Investor shall, and shall cause each of its Associates and Affiliates to, vote any shares of Common Stock beneficially owned by such Investors in accordance with this Section 2.
perturbation.changed_text: No later than one (1) business day prior to each annual or special meeting of stockholders held prior to the expiration of the Standstill Period, each Investor shall, and shall cause each of its Associates and Affiliates to, vote any shares of Common Stock beneficially owned by such Investors in accordance with this Section 2.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the time for investors to finalize their voting decisions may not provide them enough time to thoroughly evaluate proposals and align their voting strategy with their best interests, potentially leading to uninformed decisions. In some jurisdictions, this could be viewed as disenfranchisement or a violation of shareholder rights.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential breach of shareholder rights, insufficient time for informed voting decisions.
